Package uk.co.spudsoft.jwtvalidatorvertx

Class JwkBuilder<T extends PublicKey>

java.lang.Object
uk.co.spudsoft.jwtvalidatorvertx.JwkBuilder<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The specific class on PublicKey that is created.
Direct Known Subclasses:
ECJwkBuilder, EdECJwkBuilder, RSAJwkBuilder
public abstract class JwkBuilder<T extends PublicKey> extends Object
The JwkBuilder class is an SPI for containing the algorithm-specific conversions from Token to JWK or from JSON to JWK.
Author:
jtalbut

  • Field Details

    • B64ENCODER

      protected static final Base64.Encoder B64ENCODER
      Instance of a Base64.Encoder for encoding values used in JWK JSON. Used when creating JSON for implementations of create(long, java.lang.String, java.security.PublicKey).

    • B64DECODER

      protected static final Base64.Decoder B64DECODER
      Instance of a Base64.Decoder for decoding values found in JWK JSON. Used when reading JSON for implementations of create(long, io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject).

  • Method Details

    • canCreateFromKty

      public abstract boolean canCreateFromKty(String kty)
      Return true if the builder can create a JWK by parsing the correctly structured JSON with the given kty.
      Parameters:
      kty - The kty that the JSON has that this builder is being asked about.
      Returns:
      true if the builder can create a JWK by parsing the correctly structured JSON with the given kty.

    • canCreateFromKey

      public abstract boolean canCreateFromKey(PublicKey key)
      Return true if the builder can create a JWK by generating JSON for the given PublicKey.
      Parameters:
      key - The key that that this builder is being asked about.
      Returns:
      true if the builder can create a JWK by generating JSON for the given PublicKey.

    • validateAlg

      protected void validateAlg(io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject jo, String requiredFamily)
      Confirm that any alg field specified in the JsonObject matches the family passed in. There is no requirement for JWKs to specify an algorithm (most don't, in my experience), but if one is specified then it must be correct.
      Parameters:
      jo - The JWK as a JsonObject that may, or may not, contain an alg field.
      requiredFamily - The family name (taken from JsonWebAlgorithm.familyName) that must match that for the algorithm
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - is the required family is not the family for the algorithm passed in.

    • create

      public abstract JWK<T> create(long expiryMs, io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject json) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, InvalidKeySpecException, InvalidParameterSpecException, IllegalArgumentException
      Create a JWK from a JSON. This is expected to result in a call to the JWK constructor that takes in both the JSON and the PublicKey.
      Parameters:
      expiryMs - The expiry time for the JWK. This value is only relevant if the JWK is cached, it is not part of the JWK itself.
      json - The JSON representation of the JWK, as specified by RFC7517 (or one of its successors).
      Returns:
      a newly created JWK object containing both JSON and JDK PublicKey.
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the underlying JDK crypto subsystem cannot process this algorithm family.
      InvalidKeySpecException - if the data in the JSON does not represent a valid key.
      InvalidParameterSpecException - if the data in the JSON does not represent a valid key.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the JSON is not in a valid form for this algorithm family.

    • create

      public abstract JWK<T> create(long expiryMs, String kid, PublicKey key) throws InvalidParameterSpecException, NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Create a JWK from a PublicKey. This is expected to result in a call to the JWK constructor that takes in both the JSON and the PublicKey.
      Parameters:
      expiryMs - The expiry time for the JWK. This value is only relevant if the JWK is cached, it is not part of the JWK itself.
      kid - The ID to use in the JWK.
      key - The key to convert to JSON.
      Returns:
      a newly created JWK object containing both JSON and JDK PublicKey.
      Throws:
      InvalidParameterSpecException - if the data in the key does not represent a valid key (this should indicate a bug in this library).
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the underlying JDK crypto subsystem cannot process this algorithm family.
